meanings.sent1: He felt schmucky after forgetting his keys for the third time this week.
meanings.sent2: The schmucky decision to wear shorts in the snow left him shivering.
meanings.sent3: His schmucky mistake of putting salt instead of sugar in the coffee made everyone grimace.
meanings.sent4: The schmucky idea of using a fork to eat soup was quickly abandoned.
meanings.sent5: The image of him wearing mismatched shoes was so schmucky that it stuck in everyone's mind.

meanings.sent1: The schmucky smell coming from the garbage can made her wrinkle her nose.
meanings.sent2: The long wait in the hot sun was quite schmucky.
meanings.sent3: The schmucky sound of nails on a chalkboard always made him cringe.
meanings.sent4: The schmucky feeling of wet socks inside shoes was unbearable.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the expired milk was undeniably schmucky.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a foolish or annoying way
meanings.sent1: His schmucky behavior at the party embarrassed his friends.
meanings.sent2: She found his constant interruptions to be quite schmucky.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's schmucky attempts to steal the birdseed provided entertainment for the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The cat's schmucky habit of knocking things off the table annoyed its owner.
meanings.sent5: The child's schmucky dance moves brought smiles to everyone's faces.
